#IndigenousPeoples & local communities who depend on subsistence, artisanal, & small-scale #fishing to sustain their cultures, livelihoods, #FoodSovereignty, and well-being demand recognition of rights, self-determined territorial governance, and customary ways of life.

#IMPAC5

#IndigenousPeoples and local communities in the freshwater, coastal, and marine #TerritoriesOfLife are also affected by policies, laws, and institutions that generally undermine their rights and exclude them from decision-making processes that affect them.

#IMPAC5

Territories and areas conserved by #IndigenousPeoples and local communities—#TerritoriesOfLife—are extremely diverse and found in all ecosystems and biomes worldwide. They sustain and are the basis of the lives and cultures of a great diversity of our communities. 

#IMPAC5

6/8
Whether parties to the CBD recognize it or not, #IndigenousPeoples are their best allies in the struggle to safeguard the world’s remaining #biodiversity.

5/8
Any agreement coming out of #COP15 must recognize #IndigenousPeoples’ rights to lands, territories and resources, ensure that all post-2020 framework actions rise to the standard of Free, Prior and Informed Consent, and guarantee the protection of Indigenous rights defenders.

3/8
Target 3, commonly referred to as 30x30, aims to conserve at least 30% of the Earth’s land and waters by 2030, could be especially problematic for #IndigenousPeoples, as the paradigm for the establishment of protected areas doesn't recognize or respect their collective rights

2/8
The rights of #IndigenousPeoples, as elaborated in the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples, must be recognized and integrated into every aspect of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework, including all relevant targets and goals.
#COP15montreal
Respecting and Protecting #IndigenousPeoples and #IndigenousRights is the only true conservation.
